comments:
Build 20020205.

I reimported my plugins using the support in the build.  If I then attempt to 
run an inner Eclipse.  If I then attempt to Run, I get an internal error.  See 
below.

This is definitely a bug, but it is most likely caused by some of the plug-ins 
not having name or version set. When sorting plug-ins in the wizard, label 
provider is probably failing because one of the two fields is null.

I will harden the label provider to handle these cases. In the mean time,
try to locate plug-ins that have either their name or version fields undefined.

Another PDE user just reported a problem that has identical exception trace. In 
his case, he was using the same workspace that he created by importing the 
binary projects, but he renamed the actual Eclipse home directory. In his case, 
what helped is to reimport the binary projects by bringing up the Import Wizard 
and selecting 'Existing External Projects' on the second page of the wizard. If 
this has any similarity with your case, try it.

The cause of this problem is out-of-sync resources. Make sure that your 
workspace is in sync with the file system (call 'Refresh from Local').
PDE now handles out-of-sync resources more gracefully.
